newSplineChart
The function is used to create a spline chart.
To learn about the stages of creating a chart, see the
Universal graph dashboard
article.
Syntax
newSplineChart
( )
There are no parameters for the function.
Working with the function involves filling
fields of the HighChart class instance
.
Note
Adding a function to the algorithm code is done from the "Charts" section of the algorithm editor toolbar.
When calling the function, it will insert the algorithm code template, which should be edited as part of the task.

When calling the function, the code template includes methods for setting the chart title and subtitle styles, with reference to the name of the directory object used by default.
To keep the code functional, these lines are commented out in the article.
When configuring the title/subtitle style, use the
dict
function to select a type instance that is a child of the "Formatting and tooltip styles" [STYLES_DICTIONARY] type, for example,
"Main formatting style"
.
For more information about the functions and methods used to create charts, see the article
"Universal chart configuration"
.
At the same time a series (data set) of spline chart can be set in one of two ways:
def serie := newChartSerie()
def serie := newSplineChartSerie()
Also, when building a spline chart, it is assumed that there are axes with the following parameters:
chart.xAxis.title – X-axis name;
chart.yAxis.title – Y-axis name.
which are set in the following form:
chart.xAxis.title := "X-axis"
chart.yAxis.title := "Y-axis"
The axes scale is calculated automatically.
Use example
There are data on the concentrations of two drugs in the blood at separate points in time, obtained during the research. Use them to build a drug excretion chart and interpolate the values using a spline.
To do this, use the following algorithm:
